result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Edward Smith

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF RECORD 3:02 PM Defendant Mark Edward Smith appeared by video, from the Barron County Jail.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Mark Edward Smith.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. DEF is eligible for other cases recited on record. Atty Brewer requests a new dates. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant Mark Edward Smith appeared by video from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Heidi Brewer (special appearance) appears by video.  Attorney Kennerth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (21CM145, 22CF100, 21CM147, 21CM144, 22CM70, 21CM146) and recites appearances.  Attny Brewer represents DEF on 21CM145 and 21CM146.  Court reviews court record.   Attny Brewer indicates received copy of report and reviewed, unable to review with DEF.   Discussion takes place.  10:08 AM  OFF THE RECORD:  Attny Brewer and DEF into breakout room.    10:14 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   Attny Brewer indicates discussion with DEF.   Attny Brewer indicates DEF will stipulate to finds of report.  DEF continue to proceed without representation.  Court addresses DEF, DEF agrees with report.   DEF wishes to proceed today.    Court reviews competency report , and court finds DEF is competent to proceed with criminal cases.     
Court reviews previous minutes from criminal cases regarding attorney.   Court has discussion with Attny Brewer regarding minutes from 6/9/2022 hearing, and continues with Attorney process as stated.  "Court orders an attorney be appointment through the PD office, upon DEF qualifies through the PD office,  court orders the PD office evaluate DEF and report to court on qualification.   If DEF does not qualify, Court will begin process for court appointed attorney."
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Competency hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination

10:11 AM Defendant Mark Edward Smith not in court, DEF in Barron County.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer (Special Appearance) appeared by video for Mark Edward Smith. Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   DEF refusing to come to court.  Attny Brewer indicates unable to complete qualification paperwork for attorney.   Attny Brewer has filed competency examination request.  Court orders competency examination.  Attny Brewer has no recommendation for DR.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Competency hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Mark Edward Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Heidi Brewer (Special Appearance) appears by video. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court indicates DEF qualifies for PD appointment, but DEF indicates does not want attorney.  Court set hearing to have DEF present to have discussion with DEF regarding attorney.   Attny Brewer indicates DEF must contact PD office for qualification.  Court has discussion with Attny Brewer that someone from PD office will contact DEF, as he is in custody.  Court addresses DEF regarding attorney, courtroom proceedings and jury trials, DEF responds.   Court addresses Attny Brewer, she responds with own concerns.    State no comment.    Court makes finding DEF is not competent to proceed without a attorney.   Court orders an attorney be appointment through the PD office, upon DEF qualifies through the PD office,  court orders the PD office evaluate DEF and report to court on qualification.   If DEF does not qualify, Court will begin process for court appointed attorney.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order to Produce for 06/09/22

2:09 PM Defendant Mark Edward Smith in court, in custody appears by video from Barron County.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Mark Edward Smith.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Brewer indicates offer has been received for all open cases (21CM144, 21CM145, 21CM146, 21CM147, 22CF100, 22CM70),   Attny Brewer indicates she is only appointed to a few cases (21CM145, 21CM146).   Court has discussion with DEF regarding speaking to Attny on resolving cases,  DEF not interested.  Court sets hearing to have discussion with DEF regarding Attny and competency.  Court sets hearing, DEF must be present.    State to provide order to produce.
Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
CORRECTED
Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:32 AM Defendant Mark Edward Smith in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court advised DEF as to right to attorney, and DEF indicates to proceed without an attorney.     Court agrees to proceed without an attorney.  State requests Court give DEF attorney collequey regarding Public Defender appointment and Court appointment of Attorney.   Court addresses DEF regarding DEF having Attny Appointed through Public Defenders Officers and if not qualified DEF could apply for Court appointed Attorney.   DEF agrees to proceed without attorney, not interested in having an attorney.    State to proceed with preliminary hearing.  
State calls witness, Deputy Ryan Schick, sworn in by Clerk Torstenson.  State begins examination.  11:42 AM  State tenders the witness.  Court addresses DEF, DEF no questions.  11:42 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Court follows up with discussion regarding DEF obtaining attorney, Court indicates DEF has Attorney Heidi Brewer in Cases 21CM145 and 21CM146 and DEF to contact PD office for Appointment.  
Court sets arraignment.   

  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:26 AM Defendant Mark Edward Smith in court without attorney.  Defendant Mark Edward Smith in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.    Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.   Court indicates DEF has Attny Brewer appointment a few open cases, and indicates refuses appointment of PD attorney for other open cases.   Court addresses DEF, DEF indicates to proceed without an attorney.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.    Court enters NG Plea on Counts 2-7.    DEF requests preliminary hearing to be scheduled within time limits, even if DEF doesn't have attorney present.  Court sets preliminary hearing.    Court has discussion with DEF regarding attorney, and attorney rights.    DEF indicates he does not want attorney.  Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Violated bond 21CM000144
Violated bond 21CM145
Violated bond 21CM000146
Violated bond 21CM000147

11:38AM DEF Mark E Smith in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, Pro Se.  Bruce Poquette appearing for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  State indicates report has been filed, will file complaint.  Court finds probable cause to continue bond.  Court sets INIT for 4/8/22 at 11AM.   Bond continues.

No contact with Great Lakes Renewable Energy plant, 16592 US Hwy 63, Hayward WI 54843

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:08AM DEF Mark E. Smith in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten (special appearance) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF does not qualify for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 4/6/22 at 8:30AM.
